senses.de: A legal agreement where you borrow money from a bank or similar organization to buy a house, in which that organization could take your house if you do not make the payments back.
senses.ex: They took out a $90,000 mortgage to buy the house.

Tips.title: Financial Commitment
Tips.description: A mortgage is a long-term financial obligation, often 15 to 30 years.
Tips.example: Before taking out a mortgage, consider your ability to make long-term payments.

Tips.title: Default Consequences
Tips.description: Failing to repay a mortgage can result in losing your home to the lender.
Tips.example: If they default on the mortgage, the bank may foreclose on their home.

Tips.title: Cultural Significance
Tips.description: Owning a home with a mortgage is often linked with success and stability in many cultures.
Tips.example: Their goal was to have a mortgage by 30, as a sign of financial achievement.

senses.de: To give your property to a bank or similar organization as a way to get a loan, with the understanding that the property could be taken by that organization if the loan is not paid back.
senses.ex: They had to mortgage their home to pay for the medical bills.

Tips.title: Repayment Risk
Tips.description: If you can't repay a mortgaged loan, the lender can take your property.
Tips.example: They were careful to mortgage their home only when they were sure of repayment.

Tips.title: Leveraging Assets
Tips.description: Mortgaging can be a way to use your property's value to secure funds.
Tips.example: To start a business, they mortgaged their house for the necessary capital.

Tips.title: Legal Process
Tips.description: Mortgaging involves legal paperwork outlining the terms of the loan and collateral.
Tips.example: They consulted a lawyer to understand the terms before they mortgaged their property.

Charge.wordDefinition:
A charge is a form of security interest that is created to secure repayment of a debt. It is a legal claim over a specific asset of the borrower, such as shares, vehicles, or land.

Charges are applied by lenders or creditors to protect their interests and ensure that they have a legal right to recover their money if the borrower defaults on payments.

In simpler terms, a charge is a type of lien on property that acts as collateral for a loan or debt.

A mortgage is a specific type of charge that is created against a property as security for a loan to purchase the property.

A charge is a legal claim over an asset that serves as collateral for a loan or debt, while a mortgage is a specific type of charge that is created against a property to secure a loan for the purchase of that property.

Claim.wordDefinition:
Claim means to demand or assert ownership or a right to something.

It is typically used in situations where someone believes they are entitled to something, such as an insurance claim or a legal claim.

Claim is used when someone is asserting ownership or a right, while mortgage is used when someone is borrowing money to purchase a property.

Debt.wordDefinition:
Debt is money that you owe to someone or a company, and you have to pay it back. It could be from borrowing money for a car, a credit card, or other reasons.

So debt can refer to any kind of money that you owe.

A mortgage is a specific type of debt that you take on to buy a house. It's money that you borrow from a bank or a lender to pay for the house, and you have to pay it back over many years.

So, in short, debt is a general term for money that you owe, while a mortgage is a specific type of debt that you take on to buy a house.

Encumbrance.wordDefinition:
An encumbrance is a legal claim or burden on a property, which may affect its value, use or transfer of ownership. It includes things like liens, easements, and restrictions that limit the owner's rights over the property.

A mortgage is a specific type of encumbrance that refers to a loan taken to purchase a property. The mortgage serves as security for the repayment of the loan, and the lender has the right to foreclose on the property if the borrower defaults on the loan.

In simpler terms, an encumbrance is a general term that refers to any legal claim or burden that affects a property.

A mortgage is a type of encumbrance that specifically refers to a loan taken to purchase a property.

Lien.wordDefinition:
Mortgage and lien are both legal terms that refer to different things.

A lien is a legal claim on a property that is used to secure a debt. It is similar to a mortgage in that it provides the creditor with a way to recover their money if the debtor cannot pay.

However, a lien can be placed on property that is already owned by the debtor, and it does not necessarily involve a loan.

So, in short, a mortgage is a type of loan used to buy property, while a lien is a legal claim to property that is used to secure a debt.

Loan.wordDefinition:
A loan is when someone borrows money from a lender with the promise of paying it back over time with interest. This money can be used for anything the borrower needs, such as buying a car or paying for college.

A mortgage is a specific type of loan used to buy a house or other property. The borrower puts a down payment on the property and then pays back the rest of the money with interest over many years.

The property is used as collateral, which means that if the borrower doesn't pay back the loan, the lender can take possession of the property.

A loan can be used for many different things, while a mortgage is specifically for buying property.

Pledge.wordDefinition:
Pledge is a promise to give something as security for a loan, without actually transferring ownership. For example, if you borrow money from a pawn shop, you might pledge your watch as collateral.

The main difference between the words mortgage and pledge is that mortgage involves the transfer of ownership of a property, while pledge involves only the promise to give something as collateral.

Mortgage is applicable when purchasing a property, while pledge is applicable in a variety of situations where collateral is needed for a loan.

Security.wordDefinition:
A security is a financial instrument that represents ownership or debt.

A mortgage is a loan used to buy a property, while a security is an investment that can be bought or sold for profit. Mortgages are applicable in the real estate market, while securities are applicable in the financial markets.
